    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static Cannon load(Context context)
        Load the cannon! You cannot fire any volleys if the cannon is not loaded, so load it up!
        Parameters:
        context - Current context. Cannon needs this to load the request queue.

      • load

        public static Cannon load(Context context,
          java.lang.String appName)
        Load the cannon! You cannot fire any volleys if the cannon is not loaded, so load it up!
        Parameters:
        context - Current context. Cannon needs this to load the request queue.
        appName - Application name.

      • fire

        public static <T> boolean fire(int method,
               ResourcePoint<T> resourcePoint,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
               com.android.volley.Response.Listener<T> successListener,
               com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
                    throws Cannon.NotLoadedException
        FIRE ALL ZE CANNONS! FIRE AT WILLZ! Ok serious stuff. For GET requests, we will treat the params provided as query parameters, and append them to the URL. For all other requests, we will send the params in the request body.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of data encapsulated in ResourcePoint.
        Parameters:
        method - Refer to com.android.volley.Request.Method.
        resourcePoint - ResourcePoint object that cannon should be expecting.
        params - Request body or query parameters, depending on method.
        successListener - Success listener.
        errorListener - Error listener.
        Returns:
        Returns true if cannon was fired, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        Cannon.NotLoadedException - If the Cannon is not loaded, we can't fire it, can we?

      • fire

        public static <T> boolean fire(int method,
               ResourcePoint<T> resourcePoint,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,android.support.v4.util.Pair<java.io.File,java.lang.String>> files,
               com.android.volley.Response.Listener<T> successListener,
               com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
                    throws Cannon.NotLoadedException
        FIRE ALL ZE CANNONS! FIRE AT WILLZ! Ok serious stuff. For GET requests, we will treat the params provided as query parameters, and append them to the URL. For all other requests, we will send the params in the request body.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of data encapsulated in ResourcePoint.
        Parameters:
        method - Refer to com.android.volley.Request.Method.
        resourcePoint - ResourcePoint object that cannon should be expecting.
        params - Request body or query parameters, depending on method.
        files - Files to be included in the multipart/form request.
        successListener - Success listener.
        errorListener - Error listener.
        Returns:
        Returns true if cannon was fired, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        Cannon.NotLoadedException - If the Cannon is not loaded, we can't fire it, can we?
